timeline.bodyText: Why * is added here? It should work without the star.
timeline.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: Otherwise IntelliJ IDEA doesn't resolve next instruction !.idea/icon.png and show similar warning:
replies.author: turansky

replies.bodyText: I agree with @vlsi. If you add the asterisk *, commands like git status -s -u will show you numerous other files under .idea folders across the repo.
replies.author: sbrannen

replies.bodyText:
@sbrannen , I'm afraid you are not quite right.
git status -s -u does not show extra files in .idea folder.
I've just opened gitignore documentation, and the star is indeed a way to go: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore

/foo/*
!/foo/bar
replies.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: Hmmm..... strange... on my machine, git status -s -u was showing me numerous other files after applying this PR.
replies.author: sbrannen

replies.bodyText:
Cannot reproduce (gitignore works as documented):
$ git log -1

Date:   Sun Apr 5 15:26:28 2020 +0300

    Add icon for JetBrains Toolbox
$ git status -s -u
?? .editorconfig
?? git_objects_by_size.sh

$ ls -la | grep '.idea'
drwxr-xr-x   16 vladimirsitnikov  staff    512  5 апр 16:04 .idea
replies.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText:
I have st as an alias for status -s -u, and I'm using Hub that allows me to pull down a PR via am -3 <URL>. So with that in mind, here's what happens on my machine.
[junit5 (master)]$ git pull
Already up to date.
[junit5 (master)]$ git st
[junit5 (master)]$ git am -3 https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/2240
Applying: Add icon for JetBrains Toolbox
[junit5 (master)]$ git st
?? documentation/.idea/.name
?? documentation/.idea/compiler.xml
?? documentation/.idea/copyright/profiles_settings.xml
?? documentation/.idea/gradle.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__com_assembla_scala_incubator_graph_core_2_11_1_9_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__de_schauderhaft_degraph_degraph_check_0_1_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__de_schauderhaft_degraph_degraph_core_0_1_3.xml

replies.author: sbrannen

replies.bodyText: It is strange that you have multiple .idea directories. Typically the one in the root is enough.
replies.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText:
TBH, I don't actively use IDEA, but I obviously imported some projects into IDEA at some point, and that's simply what's in the file system.
In any case, isn't is possible to craft the patterns so that they apply to .idea directories in subdirectories as well?
replies.author: sbrannen

replies.bodyText:
I obviously imported some projects into IDEA at some point, and that's simply what's in the file system.

In this case IDEA will download Gradle for you  (possibly incompatible with your root project) and root project settings will not be applied to your subproject.
For example documentation isn't separate project.

In any case, isn't is possible to craft the patterns so that they apply to .idea directories in subdirectories as well?

I guess not
replies.author: turansky

replies.bodyText:
Technically speaking, the following would ignore .idea everywhere, except it would keep /.idea/icon.png.
**/.idea/*
!/.idea/icon.png

Of course, it is up to you, however, I'm inclined that .idea from sub-folders should be removed.
replies.author: vlsi
sbrannen

replies.bodyText:
I'd personally rather go with the more explicit (and IMO correct) patterns.

@sbrannen Done  :)
replies.author: turansky
